snippet: The case of Indrani Mukerjea, accused in her daughter’s death, has become the latest to draw attention in a hyper-competitive unrestrained reporting environment.
abstract: Memo from India; arrest of former media executive Indrani Mukerjea on suspicion of her involvement in death of her daughter Sheena Bora has sparked media frenzy that underscores flaws in both India's justice system and press; newspapers have largely decided Mukerjea is guilty, despite lack of any forensic evidence.
lead_paragraph: The case of Indrani Mukerjea, accused in her daughter’s death, has become the latest to draw attention in a hyper-competitive unrestrained reporting environment.

headline.print_headline: Murder Case Highlights Web of Flaws in Justice System
headline.main: Sensational Murder Case in India Stirs Media Frenzy Fed by Police Leaks
